page.title: 01SAINTFIELD GAZETTEER
page.content: }Saintfield is a small town positioned in mid-Down,Northern Ireland.It lies on the main Belfast_Downpatrick route with Belfast 11 miles north Downpatrick 11 miles south. Its name is an Anglicised version of the Irish Tonaghnieve meaning "field of the saint".Its population is approximately 2500.In the 16th century,Saintfield Estate passed from the Irish Lord Con O'Neill to James Hamilton,a Scot,who introduced English and Scots tenant farmers.In 1709 the Estate was bought by{Major General Nicholas Price}who developed Saintfield.His descendants own the Demesne and Saintfield House. One mile from Saintfield is Rowallane a National Trust Garden,noted for its landscaping,exotic imported shrubs & flowering plants.{
